subsection.title: Solving Inequalities Graphically
subsection.p: In , we used graphs to solve equations and inequalities. The graphing technique is especially helpful for solving quadratic inequalities.

example.p: The Chamber of Commerce in River City plans to put on a Fourth of July fireworks display. City regulations require that fireworks at public gatherings explode higher than 800 feet above the ground. The mayor particularly wants to include the Freedom Starburst model, which is launched from the ground. Its height after t seconds is given by h = 256t − 16t^2 When should the Starburst explode in order to satisfy the safety regulation?

solution.p:
We can get an approximate answer to this question by looking at the graph of the rocket's height, shown in .
When is the rocket's height greater than 800 feet, or, in mathematical terms, for what values of t is h \gt 800? The answer to this question is the solution of the inequality 256t − 16t^2 \gt 800
